item.title: New Minor in Behavioral Data Science
item.description: A new interdisciplinary minor is now available for students interested in the intersection between data science and human behavior. The Behavioral Data Science minor combines psychological science, statistics, and computational methods to analyze, predict, and influence human behavior across a wide range of real-world contexts. Minor requirements can be found in the RPI catalog. For questions, please contact the School of HASS advising hub at HASSinfo@rpi.edu.

item.title: LLMs and R: How Posit is Making it Easy: RPIrates Monthly Meeting (Weds, 12 Nov, 6p, AE217)
item.description: RPI R users are invited to the November 2025 meeting of RPIrates: The RPI R Users Group! Our topic for Weds, 12 Nov (6p, AE217) will be “LLMs and R: How Posit is Making it Easy!” In this session we’ll review the many ways that Posit, the creators of RStudio, is supporting data analytics that tightly integrates popular LLMs. RPIrates is led by Dr. John S. Erickson, Dir. of Research Operations of the Rensselaer IDEA and Chief Instigator of RPIrates. Pizza and salad starts at 5:30p.

item.title: Mercer XLab 2025 Take It, Break It, Make It Contest
item.description: Mercer X Take It, Break It, Make It 2025 edition is here! You (and your collaborators) can take apart and reconstruct, in your own innovative way, anything that helps you learn: electronic hardware, software, theoretical models. Show your creativity and depth of knowledge by reverse-engineering and then making something new! Fill out the 2025 Take It, Break It, Make It participation form by December 20th. Your video submission is due January 12th. Email sawyes@rpi.edu for more details.

item.description: The Mercer X Lab, in collaboration with the Future Semiconductor Transitions Program, is offering a remote Altium Designer certification course on Saturday, November 15th, 2025. item.title: iEAR Presents: Artists Felici Asteinza and Joey Fillastre on 11/12
item.description: MILAGROS co-founders Felici Asteinza and Joey Fillastre, along with their ever-changing cast of collaborators, create site-specific works that explore the history of place through striking arrangements of color and mark. With an exuberant style that champions the hand made and the intuitive, MILAGROS energizes public spaces with effervescent patterns that obliterate the seams between structures and highlight the unique attributes of the surrounding architecture. Join virtually at 6pm on 11/12.

item.title: STS Colloquium: Everyone Communicates: Making Social Worlds and Valued People in the Present | Nov. 12
item.description: In this talk, Michele Friedner (Comparative Human Development, University of Chicago) analyzes how special educators at a school for children with intellectual disabilities in India engage in collaborative sense-making projects with the children with whom they work (although there is the question of what collaboration actually means) and in the process they create create rich social worlds that are oriented towards the present and the near future. Join us 11/12 at 11:30am in Sage 5711.

item.title: New Roth 403(b) Catch-Up Rule: Fidelity Webinar | Nov. 14
item.description: Date: Friday, November 14, 2025 11:00 AM - 11:45 AM - Starting January 1, 2026, a new rule under the SECURE 2.0 Act, will impact how certain employees can make catch-up contributions to their retirement plans. If you’re turning age 50 or older in 2026 and your total 2025 FICA wages (Box 3 on your 2025 form W-2) are over $145,000, any catch-up contributions you make in 2026 must be made as after-tax Roth contributions. Learn more by joining Fidelity’s educational webinar at https://fmr.zoom.us…
